Headline: ECB to appoint separate coaches for red-ball and white-ball formats
Description: The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) has invited applications for two head coaches after sacking Chris Silverwood following the national team’s disastrous campaign in the Ashes. The England cricketing setup has undergone plenty of changes following the 0-4 loss to Pat Cummins’ Australia Down Under.Yorkshire-born Joe Root has stepped down as the Three Lions’ Test skipper after the away series against the West Indies. After Silverwood’s departure, the ECB appointed former all-rounder Paul Collingwood as the interim head coach.Earlier, retired batter Rob Key was also named as the managing director of the men’s team. The changes have come to the fore after the Brits have won only one of their last 17 Tests."The head coaches will report to Robert Key, the managing director of England men's cricket, and will have overall responsibility for the performance and management of the England men's team in the relevant formats covered by the roles," the advertisement read.Recently, Ravi Shastri, the former head coach of the Indian team, showed Key the blueprint to succeed during his stint with the England team. Key worked as a commentator before taking up the job at the ECB."Rob may have more work with the domestic game but, when it comes to the national team, it is very similar. The most important thing is getting among the players and setting a tone from the outset: what you believe in, what you think of them and changing the mindset to compete and win.“You have to be bullish and brutish in wanting to achieve that. For us, and now England, it was about setting the challenge of winning abroad, big time," Shastri was quoted as saying.England employed the double head coach formula between 2012 and 2014. During that time, while Andy Flower was the Test coach, Ashley Giles worked as the coach in ODIs and T20Is.

Headline: Fact Check: 2020 video shared with false claim that Muslims offered loud prayers on streets after clampdown on loudspeakers in UP
Description: Recently, the Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government ordered places of worship to lower the volumes of loudspeakers. Speakers were also removed from 125 places, as per the Additional Director General (Law and Order) of the UP Police. In its aftermath, a video of Muslim men standing on a road while offering prayers loudly went viral with the claim that this was in response to Adityanath’s orders.A Sudarshan News journalist tweeted the video, asking if shouting prayers, as seen in the video, was an alternative to loudspeakers. The video was also shared by the official Sudarshan News Twitter account, at least twice.The Sudarshan News Twitter account also called it an alternative to bans on loudspeakers. The news channel’s founder Suresh Chavhanke too shared the video with the same claim. The videos shared by all of them bore the Sudarshan News watermark.?..., .#BahutSaralHu pic.twitter.com/TpXl1Ri88jThe video was widely shared on Facebook as well.Archived versions of these claims can be seen here and here.The India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found the video was almost two-year-old and was not from Uttar Pradesh but from Howrah in West Bengal.A reverse search of keyframes of the video led us to a Tweet from April 19, 2020, where a person shared a screengrab from the same video uploaded to Facebook by someone named Nitin Thakur.pic.twitter.com/RhEzb4IQgxWe then went through the feed of Nitin Thakur and came across a better quality of the viral video shared on April 17, 2020.The same video was shared by another Twitter user on April 8, 2020. This proved the video was not recent.In the video, we noticed white and blue pavement railings, something that’s a staple of the All India Trinamool Congress-led West Bengal government. A comparison with a photo of a Kolkata pavement railing carried by Ei Samay, a Bengali-language daily from the Times Group can be seen below.We also noticed the signage of a Biryani Shop named "Shimla Biryani" written in Bangla in the video, hinting that this video was likely from West Bengal.Dr. Rai confirmed to India Today that the viral video was from Pilkhana in Howrah. He explained that the video was from when all places of worship, including mosques, were shut down during the first 21-day phase of the national lockdown imposed to combat Covid-19.While we couldn't pinpoint the exact date on which the video was recorded, we concluded that this 2020 video from Howrah was definitely not in response to the recent clampdown on loudspeakers in UP.The number of crows determines the intensity of the lie.

Headline: Neutrality won’t help stop war, says Ukraine's foreign minister on India’s position | Exclusive
Description: The Russia-Ukraine war continues unabated, more than two months after Russian President Vladimir Putin announced the invasion in a televised address on February 24.In the days since then, countries across the globe have taken a side, or chosen not to. India belongs to the second category. India has maintained that it is on the side of peace and appealed to both Russia and Ukraine to end the war; however, it has consistently abstained from taking an explicit position against either of the two countries at war.In an exclusive interview with India Today’s Rajdeep Sardesai, Ukrainian foreign minister Dmytro Kuleba said on Wednesday that neutrality is a position that does not help in stopping the war.Dmytro Kuleba (@DmytroKuleba), Ukraine's Foreign Minister speaks of the challenges that the Ukrainian troops face against relentless Russian attacks.'I know that #India enjoys a special relationship with #Russia, but this Russia is different', He also said@sardesairajdeep pic.twitter.com/swUIqQOfNsHe said, “We appreciate the sympathy coming from the leadership of India for Ukraine. We also appreciate the position of India that the war must stop. At the same time, I must mention that under these circumstances, neutrality is the position that doesn’t help in stopping the war. The best way to stop the war is to support Ukraine and leave Russia with no illusions that it may win the war.”“So, in my view, in times when you have an obvious criminal and a victim of his crime, it’s a moral and politically wise duty to be on the side of the victim,” he added.Recognising that India shares an important relationship with Russia, Dmytro Kuleba said, "One point should be taken into account. This Russia is different from the one India was developing a special relationship with. This Russia tortures, kills, rapes and manipulates. This Russia is in strategic decline. I hope Indian leadership will stand on the right side of history."Further, he said that the Russia-Ukraine war is also a war between the democratic world and an authoritarian once. Hence, he emphasised that it would be the "most natural choice" for India, as a big democratic country, to stand by democracy.Dmytro Kuleba also said that Russia is not as "reliable" a supplier of defence equipment to India as generally assumed."Ukraine has effectively destroyed the most advanced Russian weapons on the battleground. So is it really in India's interest to buy weapons which don’t survive on the battleground?" he asked.He said that India should choose its trade partners strategically as "India is on the rise while Russia is in decline".Speaking to India Today, Ukrainian foreign minister Dmytro Kuleba said that Russia was conducting warfare in Ukraine in an inhuman and 'barbarian' way."Russia will bear responsibility for war crimes and crimes against humanity on Ukrainian territory. Some towns and villages in Donbas don’t exist anymore because Russia razed them to the ground," he said.He added that Ukrainian authorities had discovered more than a thousand bodies of civilians, most of them shot, around capital Kyiv."They didn’t die in bomb attacks. They were shot directly by Russian soldiers. Many had their hands tied behind their backs," he described.But even with the extent of brutality in the war, Dmytro Kuleba said he is convinced that Moscow will not use nuclear weapons."Moscow understands that nuclear war will mean the end of Moscow. I don't know Putin's mind but if there are any remains of reason and wisdom, he will understand that resorting to nuclear weapons will mean the end of Russia," he said.He added, "Russia is engaging in scare-mongering and blackmailing. Russia knows how to perfectly blackmail the world. The last thing we should do is to buy it. We've to remain confident and united."

Headline: Marsh, Seifert recover from Covid, rejoin Delhi Capitals camp
Description: Delhi Capitals on Wednesday, April 27 welcomed Australia all-rounder Mitchell Marsh and New Zealand wicketkeeper-batter Tim Seifert back to their camp. The two cricketers, who had contracted Covid-19 last week, have recovered after completing the mandatory quarantine.Mitchell Marsh and Tim Seifert were seen training with the Delhi Capitals side on the eve of their crunch IPL 2022 match against Kolkata Knight Riders at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Delhi Capitals took to social media to share photos of the two cricketers from the training session."We are feeling Good. Great to have you back at the training, boys," DC said in a social media post.We are feeling GOOD Great to have you back at the training, boys #YehHaiNayiDilli | #IPL2022#TATAIPL | #IPL | #DelhiCapitals pic.twitter.com/k9XLbx44qdMitchell Marsh had to be hospitalised last Monday after testing for Covid-19, days after the initial Covid-19 scare in their camp. Tim Seifert tested positive two days after Marsh's positive test. Both the cricketers were isolated from the rest of the team even as Delhi Capitals took to the field and played their games in Mumbai, canceling their travel plans to Pune.Notably, head coach Ricky Ponting also went into 5-day precautionary isolation after one of his family members at the team hotel tested positive for the virus. Ponting got back to the camp on Tuesday and will be travelling with the team for their match against KKR.Ponting was not present at the dug-out for their previous game against Rajasthan Royals which went down the wire.Shedding light on the frustrating time away from the dug-out, Ponting said: "It's nice to be back outside again. Frustrating (not to travel with the team). I broke 3-4 remote controls.3 or 4 bottles of water might have got thrown into the wall."When you are on the sidelines being a coach and you can't control what's happening in the middle, that's hard enough. When you are not on the sidelines, and sending text messages every over, saying 'do this, do that, do this'. It got a little more frustrating," he told Delhi Capitals after rejoining the camp.Delhi have managed only 3 wins from their first 7 matches and need a change in fortunes in the 2nd half of the season to make it to eh play-offs for the 3rd successive year.

Headline: It’s an honour to work with Dale Steyn: Umran Malik
Description: Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) cricketer Umran Malik has thanked Dale Steyn for teaching him the tricks of the trade in the fast bowling department. The 22-year-old pacer has breathed fire in the 2022 Indian Premier League (IPL) as he has clocked in excess of 145 km/h on a pretty consistent basis.The Jammu and Kashmir pacer was a tad expensive to start his IPL 2022 sojourn, but has found his rhythm in the tournament. Malik said that he has enjoyed every moment of his interaction with Steyn, who joined the SRH team as the fast bowling coach back in December 2021.“I try to work plans for different batsmen, whether it's slower balls, yorkers or bouncers. Rest is upto God how the plans work or not. The advice (from Steyn) is to have plans and to execute them well. It's an honour to work with a legend like him,” Malik was quoted as saying.Malik, who joined the Sunrisers as a replacement bowler back in 2021, said that he interacts a lot with Bhuvneshwar Kumar, T Natarajan and Marco Jansen to gain more knowledge about the art of pace bowling.“I talk a lot to Bhuvi Bhai (Bhuvneshwar), Nattu (Natarajan) and Jansen. They are all such great bowlers and they help on what to do, and not to do,” he stated.On Wednesday, April 27, the Sunrisers locked horns with the Gujarat Titans (GT) at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Hardik Pandya, the Titans’ skipper, is currently the leading run-scorer for his team in the tournament.Ahead of the match, Malik mentioned that he hasn’t formed any particular tactic for Pandya. “Gameplan is normal (for Hardik), just to keep things simple,” Malik added.Malik joined SRH after Natarajan was tested positive for COVID-19 in the previous edition of the IPL. Thereafter, he played a couple of games, after which the team retained him ahead of the 2022 mega auction along with skipper Kane Williamson and all-rounder Abdul Samad.

Headline: Hands tied, face covered, highest level of pain: Ukrainians recount time spent in Russian custody | Exclusive
Description: Baranick Valentin, 53, nonchalantly pulled down his pants to show the scar on his backside that he said was a bullet wound. The Ukrainian man said he was shot by the invading Russian forces in March.Like many others, he ended up in Russian custody when they had occupied Trostyanets, a town in Sumy province that shares a 500 km border with Russia. The town is about 35 km from the Russian border.Men like him were picked up by Russian forces on the suspicion of having inside information about the Ukrainian military. They were being called prisoners of war in their own country.How did Valentin end up in Russian custody? He said he was caught when he found a grenade outside his house and went to the riverside to dispose of it."That's when they caught me. They tied my hands, covered my face, and the next morning, transferred me to the railway station from where Russian officers were working," he narrated.The railway station is in ruins. It had become the epicentre of a fierce battle as the Ukrainian military took on Russian forces who occupied the city for over 30 days.Now back at home to the great relief of his wife and daughter, Baranick Valentin recalled the horror of his time in Russian custody. "I spent a week in custody at the railway station where I was tortured. It was a living hell. Happy I could come back alive,” he said. He was taken into custody on March 18 and released on March 24.During his time in custody, the Russian forces asked him for contacts of Ukrainian soldiers and their locations.Olexandr Sasha, 41, is another individual who was kept in Russian custody.He said, "Russians entered my home and asked for my phone and passport. My phone was drained out of battery and didn't work so they took me away for verification. For ten days, from March 16 to 25, I was a prisoner. Most of the time, my hands were tied and face covered.”He told India Today’s reporter that he witnessed killings but did not want to talk about it.“I was tortured as the Russians kept asking the same questions that I had no answers to. They asked about Ukraine military, local government representatives, employees of local departments and location of soldiers.”Edward Pachkov, 33, said that his right hand was still injured after he faced ‘the highest level of pain’ while in Russian custody."Russians stopped me and asked me to show documents. Within minutes, my hands were tied and I was stuffed in the trunk of a car. Next few days, I faced the highest level of pain. I don’t feel any sensation in my hand, it’s numb,” he said.In all, 22 civilians were picked up by Russian forces in Trostyanets town of Sumy region in Ukraine. There are several who are still missing and almost every day, bodies are found in the forest, officials said.The city of Trostyanets remains tense even though the Russian forces have retreated. After the Russian occupation, not much is left of the city.India Today visited homes, official buildings and the local hospital in the city all destroyed. Some other parts of Sumy region in northeast Ukraine are still being pounded by Russian missiles.The Russians have retreated from Trostyanets but for many, the nightmare isn’t over. Those who faced the worst of the occupation still live in anxiety with one question in their minds - what if the Russian forces come back?

It had become the epicentre of a fierce battle as the Ukrainian military took on Russian forces who occupied the city for over 30 days.Now back at home to the great relief of his wife and daughter, Baranick Valentin recalled the horror of his time in Russian custody. "I spent a week in custody at the railway station where I was tortured. It was a living hell. Happy I could come back alive,” he said. He was taken into custody on March 18 and released on March 24.During his time in custody, the Russian forces asked him for contacts of Ukrainian soldiers and their locations.Olexandr Sasha, 41, is another individual who was kept in Russian custody.He said, "Russians entered my home and asked for my phone and passport. My phone was drained out of battery and didn't work so they took me away for verification. For ten days, from March 16 to 25, I was a prisoner. Most of the time, my hands were tied and face covered.”He told India Today’s reporter that he witnessed killings but did not want to talk about it.“I was tortured as the Russians kept asking the same questions that I had no answers to. They asked about Ukraine military, local government representatives, employees of local departments and location of soldiers.”Edward Pachkov, 33, said that his right hand was still injured after he faced ‘the highest level of pain’ while in Russian custody."Russians stopped me and asked me to show documents. Within minutes, my hands were tied and I was stuffed in the trunk of a car. Next few days, I faced the highest level of pain. I don’t feel any sensation in my hand, it’s numb,” he said.In all, 22 civilians were picked up by Russian forces in Trostyanets town of Sumy region in Ukraine. There are several who are still missing and almost every day, bodies are found in the forest, officials said.The city of Trostyanets remains tense even though the Russian forces have retreated. After the Russian occupation, not much is left of the city.India Today visited homes, official buildings and the local hospital in the city all destroyed. Some other parts of Sumy region in northeast Ukraine are still being pounded by Russian missiles.The Russians have retreated from Trostyanets but for many, the nightmare isn’t over. Those who faced the worst of the occupation still live in anxiety with one question in their minds - what if the Russian forces come back?

Headline: If need be, I will bowl: Hardik cagey about bowling plans after injury scare
Description: Hardik Pandya on Wednesday said he is not going to risk bowling for Gujarat Titans unless and until the need arises, hinting he will use a restrained approach after the injury scare in IPL 2022 last week. Hardik said Gujarat have plenty of bowling options and it's not necessary to push himself.Hardik Pandya began the IPL 2022 season, bowling full tilt for his new franchise. The star all-rounder had headed into the new season as the captain of Gujarat Titans without any competitive action under his belt. Hardik had taken a lengthy break to recover from recurring back injuries after the T20 World Cup in the UAE in 2021.IPL 2022, GT vs SRH Live UpdatesHardik had bowled for Mumbai Indians in IPL 2021 and has not bowled consistently for India over the last 2 years. Questions were asked about his place in the side but the Baroda all-rounder came out all guns blazing, contributing with both bat and ball for Gujarat.However, Hardik missed the game against Chennai Super Kings last week, giving rise to speculation of injury concern. However, he played down any injury issue after coming back to lead Gujarat against Kolkata Knight Riders over the weekend, saying he took a break as a precautionary measure. Notably, Hardik had bowled only 2.3 overs against Rajasthan Royals after hitting a match-winning 87.Asked if he would bowl on Wednesday against SRH, Hardik said: "I have to see.""The kind of attack we are playing I can afford to take it easy. If need be, I will bowl, otherwise I will opt out."Hardik has bowled 111 deliveries in IPL 2022 and has picked up 4 wickets at an impressive economy rate of less than 8 runs per over. Hardik had consistently clocked in excess of 135 kph but the all-rounder wants to be cautious as he gears up for a likely return to the senior national team after impressing in the new season.Hardik, as Gujarat head coach Ashish Nehra said before the tournament, has proved his mettle as a batter, hitting 295 runs in 6 matches, including 3 fifties.

Headline: Why Ajay Devgn's Tezz tezi se flopped. On Wahiyat Wednesday
Description: Ajay Devgn, Anil Kapoor, Priyadarshan - kaash naam ki kaafi hota! The trio was a part of a 2012 disaster titled Tezz, which was an exemplar of how perfect ingredients too can ruin a broth. Ajay Devgn is a Bollywood A-lister and serious roles come easily to him. Understood. But why Tezz? The film had a near-perfect star cast with a pinch of thrill and a dash of good songs - all punched for simmer by Priyadarshan. But Tezz went on to become a disaster in Ajay’s career. So much so, that jis Tezz-i se it hit the screens, usi Tezz-i se it dropped off too. How and why? Read all about it on Wahiyat Wednesday!Tezz is set in the backdrop of the UK, where almost every Indian wears dark-coloured glasses and oftentimes talk in a fake Hindi accent. For instance, take a moment to remember those friends who start pronouncing ‘cool’ as ‘kwel’ a week in America or London. Before we start, let us tell you that Tezz is the loose adaption of 1975 Japanese film, The Bullet Train that went wrong. The movie started with Zayed Khan (yeah, he’s there too but it hardly makes a difference), telling Ajay Devgn (Aakash Rana) how much he was missed. But the face he makes while trying to act! Zayed tries too hard in the first scene that will make you want to scream ‘Bas karo!’ Par ab bol ke kya faeda?Are you waiting for us to tell you about the plot? Let’s do it the other way round, just like the film. Aakash is an illegal immigrant married to a British citizen but is suddenly caught and ousted from the country. Zabardasti! Instead of applying for a VISA and fixing his misdeeds, Aakash feels that the muck he is in isn’t enough and requests the universe for more problems. And that is how vengeance comes to his mind. Wondering how? A bomb threat on a train! A plan is hatched and he knows all the steps to make his master plan a success but suddenly realises, ‘Arre, manpower toh bhool hi gaya!’ And that how Zayed (Aadil) and Sameera Reddy (Megha) get roped in. Never mind, they do a trashy job.Now Aakash’s plan is to threaten police officials (don’t miss the guts) and retrieve money in exchange for information on how to diffuse a bomb on the train. Years and years of police and bomb squad training for nothing!Yes, the only good thing about the film is Malayalam superstar Mohanlal apart from the mere presence of Ajay. What did we previously say about a dish going down the drain in spite of over-perfect ingredients? Yes, the same example applies here too. Mohanlal could have, and was, probably the only cherry on top after Ajay. The South star played a cop who saved passengers from the bombed-up train and had a gripping exit. But could someone offer him a better role, please?Slowly and very slowly, people keep dying one after the other and Aakash is one of the last people left behind. Later, some forced fight sequences and negotiations happen. In fact, it is only towards the end of the film that he gets to know he has a child and gives him a bear hug while the kid looks awkward. But there isn’t much time left for emotions and he has to die in the end (whoops). And some other useless plots later, Aakash dies. He leaves a will-turned-letter for his wife and even before we can gather our thoughts as to hua kya, Priyadarshan’s name flashes on the screen, denoting the film’s end and our wastage of time.Having said that, if you ever feel that you are wasting precious moments of your life, better watch Himmatwala than Tezz. That way you can at least have a laugh, unlike Tezz that leaves you feeling like you’re operating in a vacuum. As if life isn’t enough.

Headline: Bombay HC asks for report on Jitendra Navlani over alleged extortion links
Description: Bombay High Court has refused to grant any relief to businessman Jitendra Navlani who was accused by Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut of being a 'recovery agent' for Enforcement Directorate (ED). However, the court has issued notice to all the respondents which is returnable on June 20.Navlani is said to be a close aide of the former Mumbai police commissioner Par Bir Singh, who has not been at good terms with the present Maharashtra government.During the hearing on Wednesday, court asked the Special Investigation Team (SIT) of Mumbai police to place the Preliminary Enquiry (PE) report before them as soon as it is completed.READ | Former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh's aide under IT scannerThe bench of Justices PB Varale and SM Modak said, "Considering the fact that inquiry was initiated against Navlani, it is expected that respondent state to make a positive statement so far as outcome of inquiry if it reached to its logical end and if it reaches to logical end, Public Prosecutor to place on record copy of the outcome of the inquiry."Raut had alleged on February 28 that Navlani had extorted a sum of Rs 59 crore in his seven companies from various builders/corporates who were facing investigation by ED. It was also alleged Navlani is a conduit on behalf of the officers of the agency who collects money from the corporates investigated by the agency to settle the matters. A little later, Shiv Sena leader Arvind Bhosle filed a complaint alleging that Navlani was a recovery agent of the ED.On March 8, the Economic Offence Wing of the Mumbai police registered a PE and as soon as SIT was formed, the case was transferred to it.ALSO READ | Income Tax Department targeting Maharashtra government, alleges Sanjay RautNavlani's plea, filed through MZM legal had made 44 respondents including various builders/corporates. The plea prayed for a stay on the PE as the "state investigation agency will misuse their powers and get an FIR registered at the earliest and arrest Navlani as they are waiting to do so."Advocate Abaad Ponda appearing for Navlani told the court that the rules specify that the PE cannot continue for more than six weeks which has long passed by and that as an interim measure a protection from coercive action should be given. Ponda also submitted that the transactions shown in Navlani's account are all legitimate transactions on which he has paid tax.However, the bench said, "We can't give interim order. We are not inclined to hear without giving an opportunity to the other side."ALSO READ | Breach of personal liberty: Bombay HC dismisses plea to quash FIR against Navneet, Ravi RanaNavlani's plea seeking interim protection from arrest and quashing of the PE stated, "The state of Maharashtra itself has initiated the inquiry through Minister. He did not dare to be a complainant himself and so he asked one of his stooges to do so. This is a politically connected matter between the ruling party and an Ex-Commissioner of Police who exposed the shallow and illegal dealing of the persons in power a result of which there has been shaking up the entire state."The plea further added, "Even the current SIT is completely biased. They have been misbehaving with the lawyers of Navlani. The persons mentioned in the complaint have not even been summoned by police to date, but Navlani is apprehensive of misbehaviour and coercive action and therefore the present petition has been filed."

Headline: Don’t turn off engine at traffic signals: Bengaluru transport body tells bus drivers amid fire incidents
Description: The Bangalore Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has directed all its Ashok Leyland midi bus drivers not to switch off the engine at traffic signals. This order came after an initial investigation into the cases of buses catching fire, which revealed that the fires originated in the engine.Over the past three months, there have been three incidents where these BMTC buses caught fire. Even though no one was injured in all incidents, a separate committee was formed to investigate the matter.Anbhu Kumar, the Managing Director of BMTC, said, “We have advised the drivers not to switch off and restart the engine at every traffic signal to avoid an electrical shock circuit. Earlier, the engine was switched off to save diesel. Now, we have instructed the drivers to start the bus during the commencement of the trip in bus depots and to only turn it off at the end of the trip.”Addressing the findings of the initial investigation that revealed that the fires would start in the engine, he explained, “The electrical line and diesel line of these buses are next to each other. If there is a case of a diesel leakage, it will lead to a fire.”The order to not turn off engines has been made only as a temporary solution until the full investigation is completed. Ashok Leyland has also been asked to examine all their buses under BMTC.BMTC procured 186 buses from Ashok Leyland in 2014 that were termed as midi buses, being nine meters long and comprising 33 seats, used in the congested areas of the city.READ MORE| Govt ropes in IISc Bangalore to expand probe into electric scooter fire mishaps

Headline: Amazon Prime Video to announce a new slate of immersive stories on April 28
Description: Amazon Prime Video will reveal details of new Indian original series and feature films set to debut on its streaming service globally tomorrow, April 27. The list includes Modern Love: Mumbai, which will begin streaming in May.Amazon Prime Video's new slate of upcoming films and web series will include Modern Love: Mumbai, which is all set to premiere on May 13. This is the Indian adaptation of the popular International series, Modern Love, which is based on the famous New York Times column.Amazon Prime Video will be making the announcement at an event on April 28 at JW Mariott Sahar, Mumbai. Their invite read, 'Great stories don't just entertain. They inspire, stir emotions and above all, bring joy. And then, when you find great stories, you must share them with everyone. And we can't wait to give you an exclusive peek into our fresh, immersive stories."The list could include Made In Heaven Season 2. The first season of the Amazon Prime India original was produced by Zoya Akhtar got an amazing response. Starring Sobhita Dhulipala and Arjun Mathur, the story revolves around two wedding planners from Delhi, run a company called Made in Heaven.Another much-awaited series that the fans are eager to know about is Mirzapur Season 3 and Panchayat Season 2. Tomorrow's announcement might include some information on these web shows as well.One of the much-awaited series on Amazon Prime India is Hush-Hush. On International Women’s Day 2021, the OTT platform announced the series, which is led by an all-women cast and crew. The thriller drama series features Soha Ali Khan, Karishma Tanna, Shahana Goswami and Kritika Kamra in pivotal roles.

Headline: Sex racket running under guise of spa busted in Delhi; 7 arrested
Description: Delhi Police has busted a sex racket running under the guise of a spa in East Patel Nagar and also arrested seven people, including the spa owner. Police also recovered a huge quantity of objectionable material from the spot.In view of the increasing number of complaints with respect to illegal activities, sex rackets being run in Central District, a dedicated team was constituted under the supervision of ACP Yogesh Malhotra to keep a close watch and to take strict legal action.Police had received information that a sex racket was being run in a SPA massage parlour under the name of “The Space Spa” at 6/13, East Patel Nagar. Acting on a tip-off, police conducted a raid on the spot on April 26, following which seven people were arrested.During interrogation, it was found that one of the accused, identified as Babita and her husband Deepak, were the masterminds who were running this sex racket in the garb of SPA massage parlour. They used to employ girls in the SPA and later send them to customers after negotiating money.READ MORE| Sex racket running in garb of spa busted in Hyderabad, eight women rescued

Headline: Royals to pay tribute to Warne on April 30
Description: Rajasthan Royals (RR) are set to pay tribute to their former skipper Late Shane Warne during their match against Mumbai Indians (MI) on Saturday, April 30 at the Dr. DY Patil Sports Academy in Mumbai. Back in 2008, at the same venue, the Australian spin wizard captained the Royals to their maiden Indian Premier League (IPL) title. RR had beaten the MS Dhoni-led Chennai Super Kings (CSK) by three wickets to be crowned as the inaugural champions.The Royals, in the meantime, said that Warne’s brother, Jason, would take part in the celebrations after accepting an invite from the IPL franchise. Back in March, Warne breathed his last at the age of 52 after reportedly suffering a heart attack while enjoying with his friends at the Thai resort of Koh Samui."It is befitting that the same stadium where Warne lifted the IPL trophy will see the cricketing world come together to pay their respects and celebrate his life," the Royals said in a media release."The franchise would like to iterate that it will not be an occasion to mourn, but to commemorate the great man, and salute him for his never-ending contribution to the game of cricket as well as impacting thousands of lives around the world through his words, energy, and actions both on and off the field," the release stated.The RR players will be donning the initials 'SW23' on leading collars of their playing kits on Sunday. Moreover, an area of the venue in Mumbai has been converted into a Shane Warne Tribute Gallery. As per reports, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) and the Royals will take charge of the celebrations."The Royals have also reached out to the Batch of 2008 and are appreciative of everyone who has sent in their tributes for the greatest leg-spinner of all time. These tributes will be made available on the match-day on Rajasthan Royals' social media..." the release added.The Royals, led by Sanju Samson, are currently placed on top of the table with 12 points and a net run rate of +0.561. On Tuesday, they defeated the Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) by 29 runs at the MCA Stadium in Pune.

Headline: MP: Girl attempts suicide during public hearing in Chhatarpur Collectorate office
Description: A girl tried to commit suicide during a public hearing at the Chhatarpur Collectorate office in Madhya Pradesh. The girl had slit her vein after which she was immediately admitted to the district hospital by the Sub-Divisional Magistrate.The victim, Savita Dwivedi, is a resident of Barigarh tehsil of the district. Owing to her family’s dire condition, Savita had come to the meeting asking for a fee waiver for her younger sister. After not getting a favourable response, Savita slit her vein in an attempt to kill herself.Savita told the media that her father, Narendra Kumar Dwivedi, was posted as the Regional Event Organiser (REO) in the Agriculture Department when he passed away in 2019. After that, her mother had taken up the responsibility of earning for the house. However, the authorities failed to cover the cost of her sister’s education as well as the maintenance of their house, as demanded by the grieving family.Savita’s sister's fees are to be paid in June for which she had applied for a waiver. However, no hearing has taken place in that regard.

Headline: Mumbai: 48 people duped of Rs 3.47 crore in the name of housing scheme
Description: In Indranagar, Dombvili, a fraud of Rs 3.47 crores has been exposed involving almost 50 people as victims. The victims were promised flats and shops at cheap rates under the Basic Services for Urban Poor (BSUP) construction scheme in the city.The accused has been identified as Suresh Pawar, who recovered crores of rupees from people by giving them fake certificates of Kalyan-Dombivli Municipal Corporation (KDMC) and BSUP Rehabilitation Committee along with allotment letters and other fake documents.Kantilal Bhanushali, a resident of Beturkar Pada area of Kalyan West, had lodged a complaint with the Bazarpeth police station. Pawar had promised two shops under the BSUP scheme to Bhanushali and his father, Shankarlal, for Rs 12 lakh. From 2016 till today, Bhanushali neither received the promised shop nor did he get his money back.On investigation, it has been discovered that Pawar collected Rs 3.47 crore from 48 people in the same way. Further investigation is underway.ALSO READ| NGO head dupes 2,700 people, held for over Rs 8 crore housing scamALSO READ| Mumbai: Two held for duping over 40 people on the pretext of ‘cheap housing scheme’ALSO READ| Delhi: Father-son duo held for duping over 600 investors in the name of DDA's housing policy

Headline: Runway 34's Aakanksha Singh reveals she got a handwritten letter from co-star Amitabh Bachchan. Here's what it read
Description: After making her television debut, actress Aakanksha Singh ventured into the world of films with Badrinath Ki Dulhania. The actress later featured in a couple of movies down South. And now, she is gearing up for the release of her next Bollywood film, Runway 34. The movie also features Amitabh Bachchan, Ajay Devgn and Rakul Preet Singh. In an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, Aakanksha revealed that she got a handwritten letter from Big B and also mentioned what was written in it.During an exclusive conversation with IndiaToday.in, Aakanksha Singh revealed she wanted to thank her Runway 34 co-star Amitabh Bachchan, as he sent her a buggy when she had a fracture."I didn't know how to thank him or what to say. So, I wrote a poem and gave it to him. I told him sir, please read it. And he asked me, 'Kabse likh rahe hain aap?', to which, I said I have been doing it since childhood. He said that you write well. That was a big moment for me because he is also a great writer. Whatever he writes, he writes so beautifully - be it poems or one-liners. Since I had the same passion for writing, I thought of writing a poem first. He really liked it. And the very next day, I received a letter of appreciation, in which he had written - Prasansa ke patra aate rahenge, pehle ye sneh bhara patra kijiye swikar [You will keep getting appreciation letters. But first, please accept this letter]. It was a very big deal for me," said Aakanksha.A post shared by Aakanksha Singh (@aakankshasingh30)For the unversed, Aakanksha Singh made her acting debut with a TV show, Na Bole Tum Na Maine Kuch Kaha. Later on, she featured in another television show, Gulmohar Grand. However, once she started acting in films, there has been no looking back for the actress.Talking about her upcoming movie, Runway 34, it is all set to be released on April 29, 2022.

Headline: Tiger Shroff met the man who made the viral Chhoti Bachhi Ho Kya meme. Then...
Description: “Arey chhoti bachhi ho kya?”- Does the dialogue sound familiar? Well if you are a social media buff, you have probably come across numerous memes with this dialogue by Tiger Shroff from Heropanti. But do you know who actually made this line meme-worthy and super funny?Meet Deependra Singh, a mimicry artist, who became an internet sensation overnight for his imitation of Shroff in his debut movie Heropanti. Now, not only has Deependra met Shroff, he has also made a reel with him!“FINALLY “Chotibachhihokya “TOGETHER,” Deependra captioned the reel. He can be seen doing a comic skit with Tiger Shroff.Take a look:A post shared by Deependra singh official (@iamdeependrasinghofficial)Netizens totally loved the reel and congratulated Deependra for his achievement. Many lauded him for his on-point mimicry. His audio reel while mimicking Shroff's Chhoti Bachhi Ho Kya dialogue went crazy viral on all social media platforms.Deependra also shared a picture with Tiger Shroff and wrote about how he is his favourite.A post shared by Deependra singh official (@iamdeependrasinghofficial)Deependra Singh has previously shared mimicry videos of Bollywood stars like Salman Khan, Ranveer Singh, Sanjay Dutt and many others.Did you enjoy the reel?

Headline: Opposition-ruled states hit back at Centre after PM asks them to cut fuel tax
Description: In his first statement on rising fuel prices in India, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took aim at Opposition-ruled states during a meeting on Wednesday afternoon and asked them to reduce taxes.PM Modi said that states like Karnataka and Gujarat reduced Value Added Tax on fuel and passed on the benefits to people, despite the move hurting their treasuries. He added, "However, states like Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Telangana, Maharashtra, Kerala and Jharkhand did not reduce tax on fuel, and should do it now.""It has become imperative to increase the coordination between the Centre and the states and uphold the values of cooperative federalism," PM Modi said.The Opposition-ruled state governments have not taken very kindly to PM Modi's remarks during the Covid-19 review meet on Wednesday. They have accused him of lying to 'cover his failures', treating non-BJP states with a 'step-mother attitude' and attempting to deflect criticism targeted at the central government.Here is how different state governments have responded:KT Rama Rao, Telangana minister and working president of ruling Telangana Rashtra Samithi, took to Twitter to allege that fuel prices had shot up because of the central government.He wrote, "Name-calling states for not reducing VAT even though we never increased it - is this the co-operative federalism you're talking about Narendra Modi ji? Telangana hasn't increased VAT on fuel since 2014 and rounded off only once."He added, "We don't get 41 per cent of our rightful share because of the cess imposed by your government. In the form of cess, you are looting 11.4 per cent from the state and we are getting only 29.6 per cent for FY23. Please scrap cess so we can give petrol at Rs 70 and diesel at Rs 60 all over India. One Nation - One Price?"Fuel prices have shot up because of NPA Central govtName-calling states for not reducing VAT even though we never increased it; is this the co-operative federalism you're talking about @narendramodi ji?#Telangana hasn't increased VAT on fuel since 2014 & rounded off only onceWest Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that PM Modi's appeal to Opposition states to reduce fuel tax has a 'political agenda'. Further, she asked the Centre not to 'burden' state governments.She said, "I ask you, Modi ji, not to talk about these things in a Covid meeting. He [Modi] is telling us to decrease the tax and he will loot the tax. The PM should not speak like this, he cannot burden states like this. He said states should reduce tax but he hiked the price! This is a one-sided remark which is totally misleading."She said that the West Bengal government had been giving a subsidy of Re 1 on fuel for three years and lost Rs 1,500 crore as a result, but this was not mentioned by PM Modi."We said share fuel revenue 50-50. But they [Centre] did not agree. They take away 75 per cent. The Centre has earned lakhs of crores on fuel but nothing is shared with the states. The Centre owed Rs 97,000 crore to Bengal - give me that money and we'll give subsidies. It is not true that we don't want to provide relief to the common man but Centre is imposing a huge burden on us," she said.Further, Mamata Banerjee alleged that the Centre favoured BJP-ruled states and gave 'step-mother' treatment to others. She said, "Why should Opposition-ruled states face discrimination and step-mother attitude? This is also one type of extortion. Don't bulldoze democracy and federal structure. You [Modi] gave all the money to BJP-ruled states and not Opposition-ruled ones."TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh added, "To cover his failures, he [Modi] has lied and asked states to cut VAT."A Saravanan, spokesperson of the ruling Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam in Tamil Nadu, said that fuel prices are sky-high due to the Union government's cess.He said, "Most important aspect is cess doesn't devolve to the state government. We make a counter-proposal to the prime minister. Please don't collect cess and make it VAT - at least the price that you take will devolve to the state governments."Yet another aspect is the DMK has not raised these prices. We had reduced petrol prices by Rs 3. Also, the VAT prices were set by AIADMK. The PM instead of giving gyan should give VAT to the state. There is no accountability on cess. The Union government has earned Rs 26 lakh crore in last eight years - where has all this gone? The PM is trying to deflect the criticism against him," he added.Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said on Wednesday that the state government cannot be held responsible for the spike in fuel prices.He said, “Today, in the price of one litre of diesel in Mumbai, Rs 24.38 is for the Centre and Rs 22.37 is for the state. In petrol price, 31.58 paise is central tax and 32.55 paise state tax. Therefore, it is not a fact that petrol and diesel have become more expensive due to the state.”Additionally, Uddhav Thackeray said on Wednesday that his government had already given citizens tax relief on natural gas. READ FULL REPORT(With inputs from Akshaya Nath, Ashish Pandey, Anupam Mishra, Suryagni Roy, Indrajit, Ritvick Bhalekar)

Headline: After CM Yogi's directives, over 500 illegal loudspeakers removed in Old Lucknow
Description: More than 500 illegal loudspeakers have been removed from religious places in Old Lucknow. At many places, the volume of the loudspeakers was asked to be reduced as per the regulations.As per the government orders, illegal loudspeakers would be removed from all religious places and noise from the remaining ones would be regulated in accordance with court directions. This comes after Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath’s directives to restrict the volume of loudspeakers.Following the clashes in Jahangirpuri in Delhi, the Uttar Pradesh government ordered special measures in order to ensure peace and harmony prevails during the religious festivals of Eid and Akdhay Tritya, which are likely to fall on the same day early next month.The special measures also include no permissions be granted for any loudspeakers in the state.District Saharanpur’s Police Chief, Akash Tomar said in a statement, "According to court and government guidelines, there are limits on sound from loudspeakers and one needs permission for loudspeakers. We spoke to religious leaders and caretakers of temples and mosques and over 500 loudspeakers have been taken down voluntarily in the district. This exercise will continue for a few days."Additional Chief Secretary (Home), Avinash Avasthi said that all the Station House Officers (SHOs) of the state have been asked to talk to the religious heads of their regions and peacefully get the loudspeakers removed immediately.However, loudspeakers installed in the mosque were removed without permission in Mahmoodnagar of Harraiya police station area.

Headline: 'Be responsible': Andhra CM tells officials after incidents at Tirupati, Vijayawada hospitals
Description: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy on Wednesday held a review meeting with health officials following incidents at Tirupati and Vijayawada hospitals and called for strict measures to prevent such incidents from happening again.A father of a 10-year-old boy who died at RUIA government Hospital of Tirupati was forced to carry his dead son on a motorcycle after the hospital ambulance demanded large amount of money from him.The incident took place on Monday night at RUIA government Hospital of Tirupati where a 10-year-old boy from Chitwel Mandal village died after treatment.READ | No ambulance, Andhra man carries son's body on bike for 90 kmJagan Mohan Reddy said, "One or two such incidents will tarnish the reputation of the system. The numbers for lodging complaints should be displayed at Arogya Mitra kiosks. The numbers should be made clearly visible on 104, 108 and Thalli Bidda vehicles. It is necessary to strengthen the SOPs and protocols followed."The chief minister also directed the officials to be on alert and set up an effective protocol to ensure it is not repeated.Meanwhile, reacting to the incident in Vijayawada where a differently-abled woman was allegedly gang-raped in a government hospital, Reddy asked police officials to remain vigilant and strictly enforce measures to prevent such incidents from happening. The CI and SI were suspended due to their negligence."The police department needs to come up with stronger protocols and monitoring systems. There is a purpose you are in government service. You cannot misuse it at this level. Be responsible," he said.

Headline: Double murder rocks Prayagraj as two shot dead over property dispute
Description: Two people were allegedly shot dead over a property dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj on Wednesday, triggering panic in the area. The two victims, identified as Yasid Ali and Saultan Ahmed, were shot dead by one Deepak Vishwakarma in Chak Meera Patti locality under Dhoomanganj police station limits on Wednesday.The accused, Deepak Vishwakarma, is a property dealer and the two groups were at loggerheads owing to an old property-related issue.Their bodies were found in a house, following which the police were alerted. Police officials reached the crime scene after receiving the information and took the victims to the nearby hospital, but the doctors declared them dead.SSP, Prayagraj, Ajay Kumar said, "Four people, Yasin Ali, Sultan Ahmed, Imran Ali and Rasool Ahmed, all property dealers came to meet Deepak at his home. The two groups fought over a flat spread across 900 square feet, which led to a clash. All the four people had stamp papers and they forced Deepak to transfer the property in their names due to which the accused took out a gun and opened fire at Yasin and Sultan."The victims sustained serious bullet injuries and a Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL) team and dog squads were pressed into service for a further investigation. Police said that the accused has been arrested and he confessed to his crime.ALSO READ| Amritsar: Class 12 student shot dead, probe underway"We have also taken Imran Ali and Rasool Ahmed into police custody and are questioning them. We have recovered two country-made pistols and cartridges from the spot.""The accused, Deepak Vishwakarma, has confessed to his crime of firing at two people and his statement has been recorded. We are investigating the case from all angles and further action will be taken as per law. We have arrested Ali and Ahmed and they are being questioned to crack the case. Further action will be taken based on the complaint," the SSP said.ALSO READ| 6-year-old girl raped during wedding procession in UP's PrayagrajALSO READ| Couple stabbed to death in UP over old rivalry; case filed

Headline: Supernatural star Misha Collins clarifies he is not bisexual
Description: American actor Misha Collins, popular for his role in the television series Supernatural, clarified that he is not bisexual after he declared so at an event in New Jersey. The actor took to Twitter on Tuesday and apologised for "misspeaking" and "the clumsiness of my language".While addressing the crowd at a Supernatural fan convention this weekend, the actor said, “By a show of force, how many of you would consider yourself introverts? How many extroverts? And how many bisexuals?” He then said, “I am all three."However, in a series of tweets, he addressed the incident and said that is straight. In fact, he also called himself a fierce ally of the LGBTQ community.My clumsy intention was to wave off actually discussing my sexuality, but I badly fumbled that and understand that was seen as me coming out as bisexual. 2/5“This was not my intention so I need to correct the record: I am not bisexual. I happen to be straight, but I am also a fierce ally and the last thing I want to do is falsely co-opt the struggles of the LGBTQIA+ community,” he wrote in a tweet.“My clumsy intention was to wave off actually discussing my sexuality, but I badly fumbled that and understand that was seen as me coming out as bisexual,” he wrote in another tweet.I am deeply sorry for the clumsiness of my language. I want to be a better ally and I feel sick to my stomach that I might have done anything to make things worse. I’m trying to learn, trying to do better and I will keep listening.Thanks and I’m sorry,Misha5/5“I am deeply sorry for the clumsiness of my language. I want to be a better ally and I feel sick to my stomach that I might have done anything to make things worse. I’m trying to learn, trying to do better and I will keep listening,” he concluded.

Headline: Mumbai: Anti-Narcotics Cell seize drugs worth over Rs 76 lakh
Description: The Anti-Narcotics Cell of Mumbai has arrested two drug traffickers and seized around 508 grams of Mephedrone. The seized drug is worth around Rs 76.2 lakh.Acting on a tip received by police, a raid was conducted at the residence of the accused Abid Shaikh, near JJ hospital in South Mumbai on Tuesday evening.Upon being apprehended, Shaikh was found carrying 60 grams of Mephedrone.Officials from ANC further carried out a search in the residential premises of Shaikh and found 430 grams of Mephedrone hidden at the residence.Shaikh was interrogated and he revealed the name of his accomplice identified as Rohit Soni.Around 18 grams of Mephedrone was found from Soni.Both the accused are being interrogated for details regarding the supplier of the drugs.

Headline: Kolkata: Refrigerator set up for providing cool drinking water to locals amid scorching heat
Description: With temperatures soaring as high as 40 degrees in various parts of the country, a Kolkata resident has come up with an initiative to make sure that people in his locality of Alimuddin Street, a busy area in the city, get cold water to quench their thirst.A fridge that can hold up to 40 bottles of 500 ml each has been kept on the bylane of Alimuddin Street.Tousif Rahman, a social worker, has kept a fridge where locals can keep their bottles. However, the locals and Rahman state that it is not only for locals but anyone who passes from the area."The main objective is to provide cold water to anyone and everyone who needs it," Rahman said.Zulekha, a local, stated that many people in the area cannot afford a fridge, but this kind of initiative helps the locals. She went on to state that there is no problem with anyone drinking from anyone's bottle, even though the bottles are marked to know who owns them.However, a question that arises is who pays for the electricity and maintenance of the fridge?"At max it will be Rs 600-700 a month, but the blessings are way more than the money. I can happily provide for it," Rahman added.READ MORE | Temperature shoots past 43 degrees Celsius in Odisha; heatwave conditions likely from April 27-30

Description: Poland’s Iga Natalia Swiatek has pulled out of the Madrid Open due to an injury to her right shoulder. The Warsaw-born tennis player also defeated former World No.1 Naomi Osaka in straight sets in the final of the Miami Open in April.Swiatek clearly said that she doesn’t want to compromise on her fitness ahead of the upcoming edition of the French Open, starting May 22 at Roland Garros. The youngster reckoned that she needs some time off to get back in shape ahead of the clay court tournament next month."Basically, it's not like we have some drama because everything is okay. Headline: Temperature shoots past 43 degrees Celsius in Odisha; heatwave conditions likely from April 27-30
Description: There seems to be no respite from the heatwave conditions for the residents of Odisha as the mercury crossed the 43 degrees Celsius mark in at least nine places in the state.As per the prediction by the India Meteorological Department (IMD), severe heatwave conditions are expected to prevail in the state for the next 4-5 days.Odisha continued to reel under severe heatwave conditions as the maximum temperature crossed the 40 degrees Celsius mark in as many as 22 places in the state, as per IMD data.While 14 places recorded a maximum day temperature of 42 degrees or more, nine places recorded a maximum day temperature of more than 43 degrees Celsius.At 44.5 degrees Celsius, the highest temperature was recorded in Boudh, informed Regional Director Met Department, Habibur Rahman Biswas.i) Heat wave conditions over East, Central & Northwest India during next 5 days:v Vidarbha, Rajasthan & Madhya Pradesh during next 5 days;v Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, interior Gangetic West Bengal & interior Odisha during 27th-30th April; pic.twitter.com/K2vcnltbLmIn its latest bulletin, the MeT Centre said heatwave conditions are very likely to prevail in north interior and coastal areas of the state till April 30."The daytime temperature is likely to rise by 1-2 degrees Celsius in interior areas. Heatwave is unlikely in southern and coastal regions as a few places may receive rainfall during the next five days," said MeT director.“Heat is tolerable for the general public but there is a slight health concern for vulnerable people ( infants, elderly and sick people). It is advised to avoid heat exposure, keep cool and avoid dehydration. Farmers are advised to continue irrigation activities in sugarcane, summer maize, pulses and other crops and vegetables,” the advisory issued by SRC stated.“Situation may be closely monitored and action as deemed necessary be taken,” the SRC’s advisory further read.Special Relief Commissioner Pradeep Kumar Jena has issued an alert for collectors to monitor the situation in their respective districts.The maximum temperature is likely to remain above normal by 3 to 5 degrees Celsius at many places in districts of interior Odisha and is likely to be above normal by 2 to 3 degrees at a few places in coastal Odisha during the next 4 to 5 days, said the IMD.READ MORE| Odisha: Mercury breaches 40°C in 21 places, Sonepur hottest at 44.4°C

Headline: Fact Check: Was Boris Johnson the first British PM to visit Gujarat? News sites fall for faulty info
Description: Following Boris Johnson’s recent Gujarat visit, many national and international media outlets claimed that he was the first British Prime Minister to visit the western Indian state.Among the ones calling him “the first UK PM to visit Gujarat” were publications like the BBC, The Times of India, and The Economic Times.Industrialist Gautam Adani too amplified this claim. The archived version of his tweet can be seen here.Honoured to host @BorisJohnson, the first UK PM to visit Gujarat, at Adani HQ. Delighted to support climate & sustainability agenda with focus on renewables, green H2 & new energy. Will also work with UK companies to co-create defence & aerospace technologies. #AtmanirbharBharat pic.twitter.com/IzoRpIV6nsThe India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found the claim was untrue. The British High Commission confirmed to India Today that in 1978, then British PM James Callaghan visited Ahmedabad as a guest of then Indian PM Morarji Desai.It is noteworthy that when we checked the official website of the UK government, we found the claim that Johnson was the first British PM to visit Gujarat there as well. This was later fixed.As we began investigating the viral claim when we found a tweet by the Ahmedabad-based historian Patrick French where he pointed out that former PM Morarji Desai had received then UK PM James Callaghan in Ahmedabad in 1978.The press are saying this is the first visit by a UK PM to Gujarat, how could they forget that Morarji Desai took Jim Callaghan to Ahmedabad in 1978. pic.twitter.com/U5sN4m9zg4A New York Times report from January 8, 1978, stated that Callaghan was scheduled to travel with Desai to Gujarat.Johnson stated in his official statement post the India tour that he was the first Conservative British Prime Minister to visit Gujarat.He said, “My friend, Prime Minister Modi, Narendra, my khaas dost — is the phrase I wanted in Hindi. We’ve had a fantastic two days in India. And yesterday I became the first Conservative British Prime Minister to visit Gujarat, your birthplace, of course, Narendra, but, as you just said, the ancestral home of around half of all British Indians.”Additionally, while speaking with Channel 4, when the interviewer said, “You’re the first Prime Minister to”, Johnson interrupted him and finished the sentence: “Come to Gujarat since 1978. How about that? I bet you weren’t gonna say that.”Correction made in the British government websiteAs we mentioned earlier, the official website of the UK government stated that Johnson was the first British PM to visit Gujarat. When we contacted the British High Commission about this, it confirmed to India Today that in 1978, former Prime Minister James Callaghan visited Ahmedabad as a guest of the then Indian PM Morarji Desai.Subsequently, the High Commission corrected the information given on the website from, “This will be the first time a UK Prime Minister has visited Gujarat,” to “This will be the first time a UK Prime Minister from the Conservative Party has visited Gujarat.”Thus, we concluded that the claim of Boris Johnson being the first British PM to visit Gujarat was totally false.(With inputs from Yash Mittal)The number of crows determines the intensity of the lie.

Headline: Amritsar: Class 12 student shot dead, probe underway
Description: A Class 12 boy was shot dead in Amritsar's Fatehgarh Churian area on Monday.The deceased was identified as Ajay.The incident took place on Monday evening when he had gone out with his two friends. After he did not return home, his family members started a search for him. They tried calling his phone, but his number was switched off.They filed a missing person complaint at the police station.Based on the complaint, the police started an investigation. The boy’s body was found near an FCI godown the next day. He had gunshot injuries.During the investigation, the victim’s family members revealed that he had an old rivalry with someone, due to which he had a fight before as well.A case was registered under relevant sections of the IPC and further investigations are underway.READ MORE | Delhi: Online IPL cricket betting racket busted, three held

Headline: Delhi: Online IPL cricket betting racket busted, three held
Description: Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested three people involved in an IPL betting racket in the Vijay Vihar area. The accused are identified as Tarun, Deepak and Dinesh Khatri.The police have recovered 5 mobile phones, 1 Laptop, 1 LED TV, Rs 1,09,260 cash from the possession.Information was received by police that an IPL cricket betting racket was being operated in Delhi’s Vijay Vihar. A team was constituted and a raid was conducted.The three accused were caught red-handed playing IPL betting.A case of the Gambling Act has been registered and all the accused are arrested.

Headline: India Today TV reporter turns rescuer during fire at hospital in Chennai
Description: When a fire broke out at Rajiv Gandhi Government Hospital in Chennai on Wednesday afternoon, India Today TV reporter Pramod Madhav rushed to the spot to bring you the latest updates.However, when he saw that the fire service personnel were overworked and patients were stranded on the boiling terrace under the harsh sun, he went above and beyond the demands of his job and helped out with the rescue operation.Pramod Madhav, along with other reporters and camerapersons, carried the sick and elderly out of the hospital and to safer places, despite the risk of the smoke that the fire left behind.With the efforts of the rescue personnel and others like Pramod Madhav who pitched in, all patients were safely evacuated and no casualties were reported.Watch India Today's Hero Reporter | Saved lives while reporting the story!#Chennai | @snehamordani, @PramodMadhav6 pic.twitter.com/FtnJ24k7FbSpeaking on the incident, Pramod Madhav said, “As it was a chemical fire, nobody could go near since it was irritating the eyes and respiratory system. There were very few fire service personnel and they were overworked. That’s why we pitched in. We assisted hospital personnel who were trying to carry those who were stranded, especially those who couldn’t walk, out of the hospital.”He added, “The fire service, which did a commendable job, was trying to put out the fire in the front. When we went to the backside, we saw nearly 70 people were stranded on top of the building in the harsh heat. We noticed that since it was an old building, they couldn’t find an emergency exit. So, us media people who had gone to report tried to help move them to the shade. Later, large cranes were brought by the state government to rescue them.”

Headline: Does Congress have a Plan B after the Prashant Kishor fiasco?
Description: The Congress's failure to team up with poll strategist Prashant Kishor would go down as a case of missed opportunity or a ‘historic blunder.’What is more troubling for the grand old party is the absence of a ‘plan B’ to streamline the leadership issue and preparations for the 2024 general elections. There are nearly 12 state assembly polls lined up before 2024 including Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh, where the party is in power.The internal disquiet in Rajasthan, the rise of the Aam Aadmi Party in states like Gujarat and uncertain fortunes in Karnataka, Telangana, Himachal Pradesh etc., make the Congress under the Gandhis far more vulnerable.There is also speculation over G 23 renewing their agitation or convening a workers' meeting to force the leadership issue.ALSO READ | Prashant Kishor, Congress walk their separate ways | RecapThe prospects of Rahul Gandhi returning as the 87th AICC chief for the 2022-27 term remain ambiguous. The Congress organisational polls are due in August 2022 but Rahul is yet to make up his mind. If he contests the Congress’ presidential polls, his victory [perhaps unanimous] would be a foregone conclusion, but electoral performance in Gujarat, Karnataka, Telangana etc., may further erode his credibility within the Congress Parivar.If the Gandhis decide to prop up a non-Gandhi as leader of the Congress, the gesture would be seen as taking a leaf from Kishor’s recommendation. In fact, the public display of Kishor’s reported suggestions, prescriptions etc., has the potential to haunt Congress for a long time, as the party may get criticism for opting for his measures without giving credit.There is already a lot of speculation that talks with Kishor fell through because party bigwigs were opposed to giving him a free hand or a fancy designation or access to the party’s coffers [yes you read it right :) it is still something to be sought after!].ALSO READ | The PK-Congress deal: What went wrong | Inside storyIt is significant to note that, unlike a narrative perpetuated by a section of media, Kishor was not rejected by the grand old party on the grounds of the tactician’s ideology [rather the lack of it] or his professional dealings with the Indian Political Action Committee [I-PAC].Kishor was offered a place in the Congress and a membership in the high-profile ‘Empowered Action Group’ tasked to strategise for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. If there was any doubt about his integrity or association with I-PAC, the offer to join the Congress would not have been made in the first place.AICC general secretary and media department head Randeep Surjewala’s tweet bears testimony to it when he wrote, “Following a presentation & discussions with Sh. Prashant Kishor, Congress President, has constituted an Empowered Action Group 2024 & invited him to join the party as part of the group with defined responsibility.”The confrontation seems to be on his role and mandate where Kishor’s perception or expectations differed with the Congress high command. Kishor, in his presentation, had made a strong case for organisational revamp, settling of the leadership issue and the issue of forging alliances, the Congress focusing on 370 Lok Sabha seats etc.ALSO READ | Prashant Kishor declines Congress offer, won't join partyInterestingly, Kishor was approached by the Gandhis and not the party organisation. It is an open secret that the Gandhi trio Sonia, Rahul and Priyanka - carry enough political heft to push through anything they wish for. A classical case being Rahul’s 2019 election slogan, “chowkidar chor hai” which was not discussed or deliberated upon by any party fora.Post elections, Rahul had gone on record expressing his disappointment with party leaders’ failure to amplify the 'chowkidar Chor hai’ slogan.This was for the third time that the Congress and Kishor have tried establishing functional ties.In 2017, Kishor tried organising the Congress campaign in Uttar Pradesh. The outcome was disastrous.However, the Gandhis continued to talk to him. Throughout 2021, Kishor had a series of meetings with Sonia Gandhi where he harped on the theme of a major organisational overhaul, institutionalisation of ticket distribution system, poll alliances, fundraising etc.On his part, Kishor kept meeting a number of disgruntled party leaders known as G-23, AICC office bearers, regional satraps, and young guns directly. Sonia Gandhi then appointed a three-member committee comprising A K Antony, Mallikarjun Kharge, Ambika Soni to explore the possibility of his involvement with the Congress.A member of the panel had then told this columnist that a number of middle-rung and younger leaders had backed the move to draft Kishor but there were “muted voices” that the grand old party should not be seen as outsourcing its political activities to the new entrant.So, subject to Prashant Kishore getting a 'free hand,' PK focusing on 2024, leading the Congress charge, had been on ‘active consideration’ for over a year.On April 16, 2022, talks between Kishor and Sonia resumed. Just as it looked like the two sides were serious about forging a broad-based opposition alliance against BJP-NDA, some Congress leaders started expressing reservations on the grounds that a ‘free hand’, outsourcing political campaigns etc., may bring ‘bad optics.’Sonia Gandhi, having gone a bit too far, fell upon her favourite penchant -- committee raj. Acting on the advice of A K Antony, Digvijaya Singh and others, she proposed a 17-member empowered Action Group with Kishor as a member with a condition that he should formally join the party.In Kishor’s scheme of things, perhaps it was a case of too little. The tactician, having worked with many politicians, possibly viewed direct access to the top leadership as more functional than hierarchical or as a status symbol. If there is a next time, Kishor would need a full-fledged orientation ‘course’ in Congress’ palace intrigue, internal dynamics and politicking.
